definition: to wallow in the mire with sb (idiom); to follow the bad example of others
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
dirty/filthy/foul/corrupt/to smear/to defile/dirt/filth

sentences.english: Manning had to choose between being complicit in these atrocities, or not.
sentences.chinese: 曼寧必須選擇是與這些暴行同流合污，還是拒絕合作。

sentences.english: Monopoly and revenue streams all in one.
sentences.chinese: 壟斷和收入同流合污了。

sentences.english: They are tarred with the same brush.
sentences.chinese: 他們是一路貨色，同流合污。

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to associate with/to keep company with
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
to set oneself against/to oppose/to make a pair
jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to cling to the powerful and rich (idiom); social climbing
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
